Reviews.Title: “Value For Money, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Dubaidickie
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly basic hotel; the rooms arent that big and the ameneties are limited, but it is clean, well maintained, the staff are friendly and the breakfast is good. Not too expensive, I guess size / quality is reflected in the price and after all it is a city centre hotel in a capital city and you get what you pay for. The location is excellent; right on Taksim Square. this isnt the main tourist location, but it is central to the city. Getting around on public transport is very easy and efficient. Arguably Sultanhammet is a better location, because it is the centre of most of what you would like to see, but Taksim is pretty good also. Very cosmopolitain, I got the impression that this was the trendy part of town with plenty of bars and restaurants. I can definately recommend both the hotel and the location

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel _ Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: fowz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, twin room size is reasonable, bathroom small. Coffee and tea sachets are NOT free, kettle is available though. Very small safe box. There are 2 types of TVs, one that sits on a desk and a hanging one. Easy access to Metro and Bus, stations are across the street. Tramway is like 10 minutesâ€™ walk. Istiklal Street is also 2 Minutesâ€™ walk. Staff, 2 male & 1 female Receptionists shifts, the dark guy is the nice one, the female is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DejZu
Reviews.Content: There are the good connections through the all kind of the public transport (funicular, tramway, metro, bus, airport shutle bus). Rooms are clean, but furniture is pretty old and need renovation. Service is from average to good depends on staff person. Breakfast is various but not responds to the "european taste" - a lot of sweet bakery products, there was not procesed meet, scrambled eggs had a strange taste, cheese and salads were excellent. Heating was noisy during the night, bathroom ventilation also was noisy, the internet connection was excellent and free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at perfect location!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rishabh3010
Reviews.Content: I have booked room in Taksim metropark hotel for my recent stay after reading the reviews at tripadvisor. My choice was correct as the room were clean, comfortable and had a very good view of Bosphorus from room. Although I have to wait for some time to get the room with a bosphorus view because rooms are limited. Breakfast is also good, included in price and not same every day. Hotel staff is courteous, good and helpful. Metro station & bus station is nearby and many options for food with different choices are available outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Samkins
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Taksim Metropark with my husband during our recent trip to Istanbul, and absolutely loved the property. Just what we needed, comfortable room, walking distance from the metro station, Havatas bus stop and the Istaklal street ...! We saved tonnes of money, because we never needed a taxi... The room, while not too big, are comfortable, and we had a very nice view of the Bosphorus from there. Hotel staff is nice, polite and helpful ....! Breakfast is no 5-star spread but it's pretty decent spread ...!! I would just come back and stay here for the location ....!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for this location and price!”
Reviews.Author: Ayman A
Reviews.Content: When i was contemplating booking this hotel, i was worried but proceeded with my booking after reading the reviews here. One of the rooms booked was freely upgraded to a triple room at checkin without our request because they noticed the couple had a toddler with them. The rooms are quite spacious and well equipped but a bit noisy due to the thin walls. The location is excellent but note that the hotel is the second block on a steep hill if you have small children or people who are physically impaired. The included buffet breakfast is more than you expect for. Note that the items offered for breakfast might not appeal to visitors from Northern Europe or North America. The staff were courteous and quite friendly. I will definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “â€œcomfortable hotel with excellet location”
Reviews.Author: Laleh B
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I am so glad I can trust Trip Advisor to pick my hotel. I travelled to Istanbul with my friend and we stayed for 5 nights in this hotel in January 2012.The hotel location is very good, next to the Taksim square and Metro Station and Istiklal street are within a walking distance.Â  The rooms are very clean,comfortable and includes all the basic things a traveler might need and everything in the room worked perfectly. the breakfast buffet was nice and satisfying. Â The staff was amazing, and did everything they possibly could to make our stay comfortable.Many thanks to staff and special thanks to Mr.Cengiz KaÃ§ar Â for helping out. I will certainly return to this hotel in my next trip to Istanbul. Â I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in Great Area”
Reviews.Author: ElleBklyn
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the TMH recently. Overall it's a decent hotel that most people should be comfortable in. It doesn't have a lot of frills but it was clean. The staff was helpful and courteous. I wouldn't say they were overly friendly, they kept their distance but were always available for directions, suggestions and even kept an eye out for my traveling companion to the point of letting us know when we kept missing each other in the lobby. The breakfast spread is better than many that I have experienced in Turkey with a wide range of cheese and meat as well as fresh vegetables, breads and cereals. The only disappointment for me was the scrambled eggs. There was a large vat of them each morning that were runny enough for me to look at them twice before I was certain they were eggs. I'm sure her are some people who like their eggs runny, I'm not one of them. The coffee was very good. My room, while clean and well appointed, was very small and rather noisy. I would suggest getting a high floor (I was on 4 which is the 5th floor in western numbering) and not on the front side of the hotel. I was also surprised to find two small twin beds. I was [sadly] alone so I just needed one but i am used to queen beds when I travel so it was odd. Overall I would recommend this hotel as a saw bet at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: billggr
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location on TAKSIM Square.Rooms were clean and big.Breakfast was very good with excellent service.. Excellent value for money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: Siddharth_G
Reviews.Content: Overall: Comfortable & happy stay. Would recommend this to anyone who would like to stay close to the action n buzz near Taksim. I enjoyed it. Good: 1. Decently priced compared to other hotels in the vicinity 2. Good location. A stones throw away from Istiklal Caddesi (Taksim). Metro right in front too 3. Wonderful Bosphorous view (if you get the right room) 4. Hospitable, smiling staff 5. Decent internet speed (depending on the location of your room) Ok: 1. Breakfast: Limited vegetarian options & same menu offered everyday 2. Bathrooms could have been bigger Bad: 1. No iron and board offered. You need to use their laundry services (which is very good for a decent charge @ 1-3 TL/piece). It was critical for me as mine was a business trip

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all around”
Reviews.Author: Lauren T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropark twice during our two-week vacation in Turkey, for a total of 7 nights. We couldn't have picked a nicer place. The room was perfect - small, but more than adequate for two people. The wi-fi service was fast and reliable, the front desk was attentive and helpful with trip planning, and the breakfast was fresh and satisfying. The hotel is located across the street from the metro/funicular and a bus depot which will take you to all the major sites in Istanbul. And of course, Istiqlal Street - located right next to the hotel - is an experience unto itself, especially on a Saturday night. Bottom line - we look forward to staying at the Metropark on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: z0or0o
Reviews.Content: I was there on my honeymoon ........ when in Istanbul all you need is a quiet place to stay after your exhausting day of going everywhere actually i found this in Metropark hotel, beautiful room clean very friendly staff and i loved their breakfast buffet and the most thing i loved about it is it's location which is very near to Istiklal street where all the shopping occurs and all of this is for an affordable price 100 Euros which is pretty much a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms w/ great location”
Reviews.Author: C-130mo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights; room was really disappointing and small. Breakfast was extensive buffet. Location just off Taksim Square very desirable; close to bus, taxi, & shopping area. Walls are thin. Beds were OK. Had view of roofs from 1st floor window. Staff was helpful. Almost unlimited food choices within a short walk of front door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location;helpful management”
Reviews.Author: Eurosailornewyork
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in September 2011. Booking.com screwed up my reservation (did not send it to the hotel, so, upon my arrival, the reception had no record of my booking), but the hotel management - especially Alev Durucan, the general manager - was super helpful and accommodating. They went out of their way to resolve the problem and make sure that my stay was enjoyable. The hotel location can't be beat: right off Taksim Square. The room (mine was a delux room on the top floor) was large and nice, and I even had a sliver-view of Bosphoros. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NorthCyprus
Reviews.Content: Metropark has a great location. It us just next to the taksim square which makes it very close to the start of the Istiklal street (shopping area) and just a few metres away from the metro. Clean and quite rooms with wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean and very helpful staff and really handy for Shopping Metro Buses and Trams.”
Reviews.Author: chiangbill
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights in the Taxsim Metro Hotel. This hotel is OK. Nice hotel, clean and very helpful staff and really handy for Shopping Metro Buses and Trams. You can catch a local bus just across from this hotel to the Blue Mosque and The Grand Bazzar. And it is only 2 Lira each way. Bus No 61 B or 46 H. Also take the Metro to Kabatas, again only 2 Lira each way, down to the Ferrys.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: meloddica
Reviews.Content: we checked-in in almost 20 minutes, the staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was exactly like what mentioned in booking.com which was a relief! we received complimentary fruit plate once we got to our room. the hotel is clean, relaxed, helpful staff, excellent location right next to taksim square and metro station is only walking distance, some rooms have sea view but not ours, still it was fine.. the breakfast was delicious and had many good options. our stay was pleasant however we got annoyed of the late housekeeping service where couple of days they didn't clean our room before 4:00 p.m. and they didn't clean the room at all once, even one night we didn't give us bed sheets and surprisingly after we complained, late at night they got us one sheet only saying it was the only one left, however, when we complained to the manager she was very nice and made sure our stay was enjoyable for the rest of our trip, and she get us late checkout although hotel was fully booked that day. I would stay again in this hotel in my next trip and I recommend it for location-concerned travelers and for us it was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the most part but................”
Reviews.Author: AlexHickoryNC
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior was clean modern and well built. The breakfast buffet was nice and the staff members were helpful. However............. don't let the room pictures fool you. Our standard twin room was 10 x 15 ft. The air conditioning for each room is controlled at the front desk. You may have to ask them to turn it on.........more than once. It would be worth your while to search Trip Advisor for comments about the use of taxis for transportation in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Find something better which is value for money”
Reviews.Author: listanikotrips
Reviews.Content: I Booked the hotel rooms, through HRS.com, for the period from 25/04/2011 till 29-4-2011. (Note that the HRS shows prices in Euros and declares that the payment will be charged, at the hotel. If you must make an advance payment, your credit card will be charged automatically from the hotel in local currency, and certainly there will be transaction fees, so the price to be charged, will be higher). Positives: 1. the area of the hotel, although you can find better hotels around the region on the same price. (in November 2010 we stayed in a hotel with the same category, which was much better- unfortunately this time it was complete) 2. Parking is just below the hotel, costs 15 TL / Day 3. Free wi-fi in the rooms. Negatives: 1. The breakfast is poor. 2. The breakfast coffee (Nescafe or Filter coffee), cannot be drunk. 3. Do not expect to hear â€œgood morningâ€� in the restaurant, take care of the time (10:00 am), to have time to get something from the buffet, because nobody will ask if you want something. They gather everything in record time. 4. Better get face and bathroom towels, with you, because towels of the hotel are to throw away. Such towels you may not find even in two star hotels. 5. Do not try to contact the reception (it will be fortunate if someone answers). The morning of our departure there was no hot water (it was almost warm), I called three times and nobody answered(Room 509). 6. The cleanliness was poor. 7. There was no bathroom furniture to let your personal hygiene items. 8. The sea view photographs, of the hotel internet site, are far away from reality, (except 10-12% of the rooms).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Simplicity
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 3 adults and stayed in room 201. We were there for a conference and the next week moved to another hotel closer to the historic sites. The room & bathroom were very spacious. The beds were very comfortable. One room consisted of 2 twin beds, a bed stand and a partition dividing the room. The other side consisted of a double/queen bed, 2 bed stands, 2 chairs, coffee table, suitcase stand, TV, refrigerator, desk and safe. The large bathroom had a sewing kit, robes, slippers, well supplied with dental & shaver kit, shower caps, cotton tips, soap, shampoo & hair conditioner. The breakfast was large with many selections. The hotel was about 100 steps to Taksim Square which is the beginning of Istiklal Street. There were plenty of taxis in this location. We found only one dishonest driver, which we did not use, who wanted to charge us 4 times the amount to our distination. Make sure the driver has the day rate (1). The night rate is (2). The base rate is 2.50 tl. There was slight early a.m. noise that my husband & son heard from the mulah. We were very satisfied with all aspects of the Taksim Metropark.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: rsa86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best stays we have ever had! We were quite apprehensive booking it after reading some reviews but we were so pleasantly surprised by the place. The location could not have been more fantastic with just a few steps away from Istiklal street and the tram station. the hotel staff were so helpful and sweet. They were more than ready to provide us with ideas of what to see and how to get there. The rooms were very spacious for two of us and the bathroom was small but clean with towels being refreshed every two days. and the view from one of the windows across the sea was wonderful. we stayed there a week and it felt like home. the only downside was that the wi-fi signals would only come at a particular spot in the room near the door but other than that a very pleasant stay and i would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: beccy7844
Reviews.Content: The Taksim Metropark is well positioned about 30m off Taksim Square which keeps the noise of the square away from the bedrooms. The road to the hotel is steep, though only for the 30m, but it could be a problem for disabled people. It is a nice hotel and the staff we encountered spoke good english. We had room 411 which was a standard double, we were suprised to find that we had a sea view which was a bonus. The room was a reasonable size with all that you would expect, safe, mini bar, tv, lots of plugs and a good bathroom with toiletries and hairdryer. There is free wifi in the hotel. The only food we had was breakfast. The breakfast was nice. It had all that you would want... cooked breakfast, fruit, cereal, cheese, cakes and bread etc. There are numerous restaurants nearby serving everything from turkish food to Italian to McDonalds etc. Our dilema when chosing a hotel was where. We hadn't visited Istanbul before, so didn't know whether to stay in the old city or Taksim. We were pleased that we chose Taksim. A nice walk down the main street to the Bridge (or tram and tunnel if you don't want to walk) and you are in the old city with all the attractions. My only slight issue with this hotel was that at 5am I could hear the call to prayer, though it lasted only a few minutes. I would certainly stay here again if I return to Istanbul. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location .... Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hrkhan
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay in this hotel again, primarily due to the fantastic location. Its a minutes walk from Taksim Square, which offers everything to a tourist and Istaksal street, which has all the pubs, restaurants shops and for me was the center of nightlife in Istanbul. The 2 min distance from the metro station was also ideal to connect us to the whole city. The view was OK, however the room was spacious and great, and the cleaniness was awesome. Although its a small hotel, however it was spic and span and very comfortable. The worse part of it was the complimentary breakfast which was really really bad and ended up having nothing but a glass of water. The staff were also nice.]

Reviews.Title: “location location but...”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great location but rooms are small and noisy and it's quite difficult to rest properly. Service is good and so the breackfast, very close to the shopping area and the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nouma
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why people gave good review to this hotel. Actually it is really difficult to call it â€œHotel" it looks more like a guesthouse. I will admit that 1-2 staff was nice and educated however rest of them were terrible. When I first enter to the hotel I was shocked how come this hotel has for stars? Its entrance is so small and makes you feel depressed and insecure. The rooms are average quality, but believe me if room is the only thing you are looking for you can find better places with very very reasonable prices. Anything else you expect beside the room is going to be big disappointment. I booked a sea view room ,which was advised to me before to stay, due to our arrival was early to istanbul the receptionist told us that the hotel is full and we have to wait till noon unless we gave up previously booked room. Since we were very tired, we gave up our booked room and accept anything that they can gave us (which took 2 hours). And then I realized that the hotel was empty. In this empty hotel it took us to call at least 3-4 times to ask for lacking things such as soap. A friend of mine came to visit me however the "nice" hotel staff stopped him and said that it was forbidden to visit guests at their room. That was very rude and very primitive "guesthouse" minded behavior. When I ask to the staff they showed an unbelievable rude attitude, and I had to chat outside the hotel with my friend. This is ok for small and amateur places however It is not acceptable if a hotel has 4 stars (I will never understand how come this hotel has those stars). This hotel is nice guesthouse, however it doesnâ€™t deserve more than 2 stars and ten times overpriced then they reserve.

Reviews.Title: “Very valid alternative to Marmara Hotel at Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: goingshopping
Reviews.Content: Very valid hotel - we moved to this hotel from the Marmara Hotel at Taksim Square as I was not happy. The Marmara hotel was EUR150 for a double room with breakfast and in comparison the Metropark was EUR90 for a double room with breakfast. Yes the Marmara has a nicer foyer and a pool area but the rooms are VERY cramped, VERY noisy unless you pay EUR30 extra to NOT be on Taksim Square and at breakfast the selection is more vast but wow it gets crowded. In comparison the Metropark is very clean, big rooms, relatively well decorated, free wifi, breakfast still has a good selection (mueslis, juices, scrambled eggs, fruit etc...) and the distance from the Marmara is 50metres! Taksim Square is a good location for shopping and restaurants but to get to the Mosques etc... you need to take public transport/taxis...

Reviews.Title: “Maybe one of the best choices for a tourist.”
Reviews.Author: Theodore2310
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a very nice spot. A hidden gem right in the center of the city. I will definitely come back. It is often cheaper from other overpriced hotels in the same area, however it is definitely one of the best hotels in the Taksim square area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: asiatraveler142
Reviews.Content: Cannot beat the location, clean nice hotel. I thought rooms were very nice, clean, good condition. The hotel is right in Taksim Square. The breakfast were OK...not fantastic, but they were decent. I paid 85 Euros per night, breakfast included, stayed 5 nights, They also had car service to meet me at airport for an extra 25 euros, which was nice after a 13 hour plane trip. The view from my room was of a back alley. I did not really care.I was very pleased overall, would definitely stay again. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Taksim area”
Reviews.Author: Rekha
Reviews.Content: Taksim Metro is a great place to stay. Its centrally located and is just 15mts away by taxi from all the great sights. Rooms were decent so was the breakfast. I would definitely recommend this place if you want to have best of both old and modern Istanbul. Word of caution - the taxis available near the hotel may cheat you sometimes by putting the night tariff meter so beware! You may end up paying double of what the normal price is.

Reviews.Title: “100% Value for money - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SpyrosT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Taksim Metro Park in August 2008 for 4 nights. The hotel is a typical city/downtown 4 stars hotel,in the best location (Taksim Square) but still very quiet. The rooms are spotless, modern and some of them (like ours) have view to the Bosporus. However, they have no balconies and they are quite small. Bathroom is fine, but the A/C system is a bit hard to interpret (for instance it somehow started in the middle of the night!!) One thing that was a bit disapointing, was breakfast. Even if it was buffet style, the hotel owners should enrich it...don't expect much.. Reception works perfectly, these people are very friendly and they can help you out with your transportation, answer all kind of questions etc The price we paid(110 euros/night) totally worth it, we have a feeling that value/money reached 1/1. In general i would recomend this hotel for buisness travels or to people like us, who wanted to walk the city, go sightseeing and been to the streets nearly all day. . If you ask for luxury, this is not the right hotel for you..

Reviews.Title: “i have tried it ..i recommend it!!”
Reviews.Author: escalibra
Reviews.Content: i didn't find much reviews about this hotel when i was searching for advice before heading to Istanbul. even my travel agent couldn't say much. i only checked the hotel website and thought it looked o.k...based on that,i reserved a double room there!! it was risky...but once there ,the hotel looked exactly like in the photos, a cozy four stars, with a helpful staff. the room was clean,the bathroom as well , we were a bit disappointed with the view from our room,so we asked to move to another room with a sea view ...which they did next day... the breakfast buffet was varied and fresh . most important is that once we went out of the hotel we were directly on Taksim square, from there we could either take the nostalgic tramway , the metro or a cab. the hotel is located at the end of the busy Istiklal road, so whether by day or night it was really easy to go around ,just by walking ....for shopping or sightseeing and by night to have a drink in one of the many pubs and clubs around. i was satisfied with my stay there, so as soon as i came back home,i wanted to share a review, to recommend this hotel... Nadine T.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: usniddoc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off Taksim Square, very close to major shopping pedestrian zone. Easy access to Metro. Hotel was clean and efficient, although air conditioning was hard to interpret. View from my standard room was terrible (side alleyway). A problem (common in the Near and Middle East) is that the call to prayer can be heard very loudly: the hotel is not particularly soundproof. Breakfast was included in my room rate and was adequate but not exceptional, and clearly continental in style (hardly any meat, etc). My biggest difficulty was the cost of the room: over 200 euros per night. I have stayed in much better hotels in the heart of major European capitals for less than this. Not sure why the hotel is so expensive (has the Turkish Lira appreciated a lot against the Euro lately?). On the whole, an OK hotel but I will not make a special effort to return.

HotelInfo.Name: Taksim Metropark Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Osmanli Sok no.4 | Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
